designScenario.name: Fluid Distribution System
designScenario.description: The Fluid Distribution System (FDS) is a mission-critical subsystem responsible for adaptive thermal management and precision delivery of de-icing/anti-icing fluids across all protected surfaces. It integrates smart flow modulation, real-time viscosity compensation, and predictive ice detection algorithms to optimize fluid usage. The system features a triple-redundant architecture with self-diagnostic capabilities, ensuring compliance with EASA CS-25 and FAA AC 20-73C standards while maintaining compatibility with next-generation sustainable aviation fluids.

details.description: The system shall autonomously adjust flow characteristics based on real-time sensor inputs including airspeed, outside air temperature, and ice detection radar signals using PID-controlled proportional valves.
Must maintain fluid viscosity between 15-300 cP across operational temperatures (-40°C to +70°C) while sustaining flow rates of 75-150 L/min at 1.5-6 bar dynamic pressure.
Implement triple modular redundancy (TMR) in pump control circuits with cross-channel monitoring and automatic isolation of degraded channels per DO-254 Level A requirements.
Field-replaceable units (FRUs) shall be swappable within 15 minutes MTTR using standard line maintenance tools, with health monitoring via ARINC 664 interfaces.

systemComponents.name: Smart Distribution Hub
systemComponents.description: Central processing unit with dual FPGAs for real-time fluid dynamics modeling and decision-making, incorporating MEMS-based pressure/temperature sensor fusion

subComponents.name: Fluid Dynamics Processor
subComponents.description: Dual-channel computing module executing computational fluid dynamics (CFD) algorithms for flow optimization

subComponents.name: Health Monitoring Unit
subComponents.description: Continuous condition-based monitoring subsystem with prognostic capabilities for pump wear prediction

systemComponents.name: High-Efficiency Pump Assembly
systemComponents.description: Triple-redundant positive displacement pumps with titanium alloy internals rated for 20,000 PSI cyclic operation

subComponents.name: Main Drive Pump
subComponents.description: Primary flow generator with variable frequency drive (VFD) motor for precision RPM control

subComponents.name: Backup Cartridge Pump
subComponents.description: Sealed standby unit with pyro-activated quick-connect for emergency deployment

systemComponents.name: Thermal Regulation Unit
systemComponents.description: Active temperature management subsystem maintaining fluid viscosity through Peltier-effect heating/cooling plates

subComponents.name: Viscosity Compensator
subComponents.description: Multi-zone heat exchanger with graphene-enhanced thermal transfer surfaces

relationships.description: The hub directly controls and monitors all pump assembly operations through MIL-STD-1553B data buses
Thermal management system shares physical interfaces with pump housing but operates as independent subsystem
Receives flight phase data and environmental parameters via AFDX network for system mode selection
